meanings.definition: relating to or produced by electrolysis
meanings.sent1: The electrolytic process separated the water into hydrogen and oxygen.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the electrolytic reaction in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The electrolytic experiment fizzled out when the power went off.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an electrolytic spark, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The electrolytic solution bubbled and sizzled, showing its power.

meanings.definition: of or relating to an electrolyte
meanings.sent1: The sports drink contained electrolytic minerals to keep the athletes hydrated.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the importance of electrolytic balance in the body.
meanings.sent3: The electrolytic drink tasted salty but refreshing.
meanings.sent4: His words had an electrolytic effect, energizing the team.
meanings.sent5: The electrolytic solution conducted electricity, proving its electrolyte nature.

meanings.definition: capable of conducting electricity by electrolysis
meanings.sent1: The electrolytic material allowed the current to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: The wire was made of an electrolytic substance for efficient conduction.
meanings.sent3: The electrolytic wire hummed with energy when connected to the battery.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were like electrolytic pathways, connecting different fields of study.
meanings.sent5: The electrolytic solution lit up the bulb, demonstrating its conductivity.
